msContents.summary: 1 copy of Mujmil al-Tārīkh baʿd-i Nādiriyyah by Abū 'l-Ḥasan Ibn Muḥammad Amīn Gulistānah

msItem.title: Mujmil al-Tārīkh baʿd-i Nādiriyyah
مجمل التاریخ بعد نادریه

note.p: On the final page, the date 1196AH, or 1782, is mentioned which suggests the manuscript is late eighteenth century. This is not, however, a date signature on the manuscript.

msItem.incipit: بسم الله الرحمن الرحیم. الحمد لله رب العالمین والصلوة والسلام علی خیر خلقه محمد.
msItem.explicit: وابو الفتح خان را با مردان شهر درمی صره دارد.

author.persName: ابو الحسن ابن محمد امین گلستانه

supportDesc.support: Thin cream woven paper with guards and supports.

condition.p: Excellent condition. Some stains and smudges.

handDesc.summary: Thick-line black ink nastaʿlīq with frequent rubrications.

additions.p: On f1v, William Jones has signed his name above the basmalah.
Frequent marginal additions in Persian throughout the manuscript.

bindingDesc.p: Standard India Office half leather binding with wine coloured marbled endpapers.

provenance.p: RSPA 1-118 were presented to the Royal Society in January 1792 by Sir William and Lady Jones. According to Wilkins, this manuscript was presented by Lady Jones.
The Royal Society's collection of 280 Persian and Arabic, and 86 Sanskrit manuscripts were transferred to the India Office Library in 1876.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on E. Denison Ross and E. G. Browne, Catalogue of two collections of Persian and Arabic manuscripts preserved in the India Office Library (London: Eyre and Spottiswoode, 1902), p. 8 no. XII
